Total population of PUMA that roughly matches CD. For CDs that share a PUMA with another CD (BX1/BX2, BX3/BX6, MN1/MN2, MN4/MN5), the population estimate cannot be reliably disaggregated to individual districts.

The NYCgov poverty rate, which is a poverty measurement specific to New York City. The NYCgov poverty threshold is based on national expenditures on food, clothing, shelter and utilities adjusted for the high cost of housing in New York City. The income side of the measure includes the value of anti-poverty programs such as SNAP, housing assistance, and the earned income tax credit among others as family resources while accounting for medical spending and the costs of commuting and childcare for workers. The NYCgov poverty measure is a historically higher, but more realistic, measure of poverty than the official U.S. measure. That measure does not account for local costs of living, or the value of most anti-poverty benefits.  For more information about the NYCgov Poverty measure see http://www1.nyc.gov/site/opportunity/poverty-in-nyc/poverty-measure.page.
Source: American Community Survey 2012-2016 5-year estimates, Mayor's Office for Economic Opportunity

Percentage of owner-occupied units with a mortgage within the 2015 Preliminary Flood Insurance Rate Maps (PFIRM) 1% annual chance floodplain. Mortgage refers to all forms of debt where the property is pledged as security for repayment of the debt. Mortgage status is an important determinant in the floodplain as any property with a federally-insured mortgage must carry a federal flood insurance policy.

Percentage of owner-occupied household units with a mortgage within the 2050s 1% annual chance floodplain*. Mortgage refers to all forms of debt where the property is pledged as security for repayment of the debt. Mortgage status is an important determinant in the floodplain as any property with a federally-insured mortgage must carry a federal flood insurance policy.

Percentage of renter-occupied household units considered cost-burdened within the 2015 Preliminary Flood Insurance Rate Maps (PFIRM) 1% annual chance floodplain. Renter-occupied households are characterized as cost-burdened if 30% or more of household income is spent on housing costs.

Percentage of renter-occupied units considered cost-burdened, within the  2050s 1% annual chance floodplain*. Renter-occupied households are characterized as cost-burdened if 30% or more of household income is spent on housing costs.

Percentage of owner-occupied household units considered cost-burdened within the 2015 Preliminary Flood Insurance Rate Maps (PFIRM) 1% annual chance floodplain. Owner-occupied households are characterized as cost-burdened if 30% or more of household income is spent on housing costs.

Percentage of owner-occupied units considered cost-burdened, within the  2050s 1% annual chance floodplain*. Owner-occupied households are characterized as cost-burdened if 30% or more of household income is spent on housing costs.

*Note on future floodplain determination: The 2050s 1% annual chance floodplain projections are derived from the New York City Panel on Climate Change (NPCC) 90th percentile projections for Sea Level Rise. For more information, please visit "Building the Knowledge Base for Climate Resiliency: New York City Panel on Climate Change 2015 Report," January 2015, http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/nyas.2015.1336.issue-1/issuetoc
